title: Digital Twin-Based 3D Map Management for Edge-Assisted Mobile Augmented Reality. (arXiv:2305.16571v1 [cs.NI])
abstract: In this paper, we design a 3D map management scheme for edge-assisted mobile augmented reality (MAR) to support the pose estimation of individual MAR device, which uploads camera frames to an edge server. Our objective is to minimize the pose estimation uncertainty of the MAR device by periodically selecting a proper set of camera frames for uploading to update the 3D map. To address the challenges of the dynamic uplink data rate and the time-varying pose of the MAR device, we propose a digital twin (DT)-based approach to 3D map management. First, a DT is created for the MAR device, which emulates 3D map management based on predicting subsequent camera frames. Second, a model-based reinforcement learning (MBRL) algorithm is developed, utilizing the data collected from both the actual and the emulated data to manage the 3D map. With extensive emulated data provided by the DT, the MBRL algorithm can quickly provide an adaptive map management policy in a highly dynamic environment. Simula

translated_title: 基于数字孪生的边缘协助移动增强现实三维地图管理
translated_abstract: 本文为辅助移动增强现实（MAR）设计了一个三维地图管理方案，以支持个体MAR设备的姿态估计。通过定期选择适当的一组相机帧上传以更新三维地图，目标是将MAR设备的姿态估计不确定性最小化。为了解决动态上行数据速率和MAR设备的时变姿态的挑战，我们提出了一种基于数字孪生的方法来进行三维地图管理。首先，为MAR设备创建一个数字孪生，它基于预测后续相机帧来模拟三维地图管理。其次，开发了一种基于模型的强化学习算法（MBRL），利用从实际和模拟数据收集的数据来管理三维地图。通过数字孪生提供的大量模拟数据，MBRL算法可以在高度动态的环境中快速提供自适应地图管理策略。模拟结果表明，与基线方案相比，我们提出的基于数字孪生的方法显著降低了姿态估计的不确定性。
tldr: 本文提出了一种基于数字孪生的方案，用于辅助移动增强现实的三维地图管理，可显著降低姿态估计的不确定性，可以在高度动态的环境中快速提供自适应地图管理策略。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a digital twin-based approach for 3D map management of edge-assisted mobile augmented reality (MAR). The approach significantly reduces pose estimation uncertainty and can quickly provide an adaptive map management policy in a highly dynamic environment.
